snippet: Mississippi County, Ark., has two county seats and two courthouses. Officials want to consolidate into one. But Osceola does not want to lose out.
abstract: Local officials in Mississippi County, Ark, are seeking to save money by shutting down courthouses in dual county seats of Osceola and Blytheville, consolidating them into single $15 million complex in Blytheville; push has led to widespread debate in county, where issues of tradition and culture have seemed just as important as fiscal concerns; Mississippi County is among small handful in nation with two county seats.
lead_paragraph: Mississippi County, Ark., has two county seats and two courthouses. Officials want to consolidate into one. But Osceola does not want to lose out.

headline.main: Arkansas Town Frets About Losing a Courthouse, and an Identity
headline.print_headline: Fretting About Losing a Courthouse, and an Identity
